item.title: A blog post created with the Netlify backend
item.description: First, you’ll need to register your application. Every registered OAuth application is assigned a unique Client ID and Client Secret. The Client Secret should not be shared! That includes checking the string into your repository. You can fill out every piece of information however you like, except the Authorization callback URL. This is easily the most important piece to setting up your application. It’s the callback URL that GitHub returns the user to after successful authentication.
